    • Uses of AsyncControllerCallback in org.openremote.console.controller.connector

      Methods in org.openremote.console.controller.connector with parameters of type AsyncControllerCallback 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ControllerConnector.connect(AsyncControllerCallback<ControllerConnectionStatus> callback)
      Connects to the controller and maintains the connection; it is the connectors responsibility to notify the caller via the callback onFailure method when the connection closes for some reason
      void ControllerConnector.getDevice(java.lang.String deviceName, AsyncControllerCallback<Device> callback)
      Returns Device that matches the supplied device name.
      void ControllerConnector.getDeviceList(AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.List<DeviceInfo>> callback)
      Returns List of DeviceInfo of devices that are recognised by this controller.
      void ControllerConnector.getPanel(java.lang.String panelName, AsyncControllerCallback<Panel> callback)
      Returns Panel definition of the specified panel.
      void ControllerConnector.getPanelList(AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.List<PanelInfo>> callback)
      Returns List of PanelInfo of panels that are recognised by this controller.
      void ControllerConnector.getSensorValues(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> sensorIds, AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>> callback)
      Returns Map of sensor IDs and values.
      void SingleThreadHttpConnector.logout(AsyncControllerCallback<java.lang.Boolean> callback) 
      void ControllerConnector.logout(AsyncControllerCallback<java.lang.Boolean> callback)
      Logs out of the controller.
      void AndroidHttpConnector.logout(AsyncControllerCallback<java.lang.Boolean> callback) 
      void ControllerConnector.monitorSensors(java.lang.String uuid, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> sensorIds, AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>> callback)
      Returns Map of sensor IDs and values only for sensors whose values have changed since the last request.
      void ControllerConnector.sendCommand(Command command, java.lang.String parameter, AsyncControllerCallback<CommandResponse> callback)
      Returns Boolean indicating whether command send request was successful.
      void ControllerConnector.sendControlCommand(ControlCommand command, AsyncControllerCallback<ControlCommandResponse> callback)
      Returns Boolean indicating whether control command send request was successful.
